Review: I stayed in Singapore for four nights. My friends and I flew from America and South Korea to reunite (a 22 hour flight for me). We stayed our first three nights at Oasia Downtown (which was phenomenal) and splurged for a room at Marina Bay Sands on our final night. I upgraded our room to premier specifically for the view—paying around $1500.00 for what was supposed to be a special night with friends. Unfortunately, my stay at MBS was the worst lodging experience we had while in Singapore. Upon arrival, an employee of the hotel by the check-in line asked me and my friends if we were Deluxe (the cheapest rooms) or Premier. I told him, “I’m pretty sure we’re Premier, but I’ll check my reservation.” His response, “I’m pretty sure you’re Deluxe.” I showed him my reservation confirmation, Premier. He said he was sorry and walked away from the area before I could catch his name. This man made a value judgement upon looking at us, and it was insulting. Then, our room was not ready at 3:30pm (30 minutes after check-in). We asked the hotel to store my friend’s insulin in a refrigerator until our room was ready as this was time sensitive—and keeping her insulin cool a must. We were told our only option was to accept a room on the 8th floor if we needed to store the insulin right away. We had no choice. The view was not what we payed for, and it was extremely disappointing. Additionally, guests at the hotel made a status judgement of me when getting off at the 8th floor. I was literally called poor. For $1500 for one night, we were looked down upon by guests and staff alike. I messaged the hotel, and I did not hear back from them until late at night, saying our room was technically premier (in spite of being on one of the lowest floors). While they admitted they handled the situation poorly, they did nothing to rectify the situation. Was the view from the pool nice? Sure. Was the hospitality of the staff or the accommodations worth $1500? No. Marina Bay Sands is all...

Review: When we arrived at the hotel, we were shocked to find out that our reservation had been canceled without any prior notice. The hotel staff claimed that Booking.com was responsible and that we should take up the matter with them. Despite our efforts to resolve the situation, we were left without a room and were asked to pay a cancellation fee. We spent hours in frustration, trying to sort things out with the hotel, even calling Booking.com, who assured us they had not canceled our booking. The hotel seemed indifferent to our predicament. Ultimately, the hotel canceled our reservation without informing us and tried to charge us for their mistake, leaving us stranded. With no other options, we had to spend the night in a substandard room because we had nowhere else to go. It’s clear that the hotel’s popularity has led to poor customer service, as they cater mainly to large groups and delegations. While the hotel might be in a desirable location, there are plenty of other hotels in Singapore that offer similar amenities without the hassle. The breakfast situation was chaotic, with long waits and overcrowded dining areas, making the stay feel more like a chore than a vacation. If you value peace and efficiency, I would recommend looking at other hotels in the area. It’s better to enjoy the view of Marina Sands Bay from afar than to deal with such inconveniences.

My experience at Marina Sans was one of the most painful, I had so many expectations. I invested savings that I have worked for 12 years to achieve that dream and the saddest thing is that the hotel, even knowing all this, has not done anything. Not even an apology.

Review: Unfortunately the infinity pool service is a disaster, they are rude and impolite We felt like in prison, we were constantly watched and controlled. You pay a lot of money for a hotel and you are constantly scolded by the staff like a small child. For example, I dipped my foot in a flip-flop in the water only to spread a towel on a lounger. An employee immediately appeared who impolitely instructed me that I can't put my foot in the flip-flops in the water! The bar is also a disaster - there was only one bartender for a huge mass of customers. As a result, we waited 20 minutes in the scorching sun for our drink. Rude staff in front of the the restaurant at the entrance to the pool (I don't know the name of the place). I wasn't allowed to get in because of the "dress code" (I was wearing short trousers, T-shirt and sandals). But moment later the guard let in a woman in much shorter trousers. What is it about? To sum up, the poor level of service at the infinity pool made staying at the hotel a bad experience. I think it was waste of money.

Review: One of the worst experiences from a hotel, the staff were extremely rude and abrupt. The manner in which they addressed us was terrible. The entire check in experience was painfully long and drawn out. From the moment we arrived we were treated like we were inconveniencing the hotel staff by being there, our bags where taken in storage before we even completely jumped off the taxi and we were told we cannot get the bags till we checked into our rooms. We had to request multiple times to have our bags returned and eventually after hours we received the bags. A portion of our group had to go make other arrangements for accommodation at another hotel which resulted in additional costs for us. The check in process was tedious, when we arrived we were told that we can only start check in at 6am as we arrived at 2am the reception also advised us that we can only early check in from 6am, there were no waiting rooms or lounges made available to us and we were told to wait in the middle of the reception area till 6am. There was one staff member that advised we could wait at the back of another reception area as there are 2 seats available there, At 6am we started the check in process and only after payment was completed did the reception advise we cannot do an early check in and we need to wait till 3pm to get a room! They advised they can offer temp cards to give us access to some of the facilities but they could not be used as they are closed or temporary closed due to weather, We then went back to the back reception area which had the 2 seats and around 8am was told we cannot use this area to wait and we have to find another area And again no waiting area or lounge was made available to us, we had to make alternate arrangements to find an area we could wait at till 3pm. Review: Room was on the garden side on a low floor right next to the highway. There is fair bit of noise from that. The TV didn't work for almost 2 days and just came up with an error so it literally wouldn't do anything at all. There was an infestation of small flies coming out of the air vent in the bathroom which ended up sitting all over my towel and bath robe (see pics), as well as hanging around the toilet and buzzing around the bedroom. They don't rush themselves with the cleaning, I came back at almost 4pm and the cleaner had not yet been. I wanted to get in the shower before going back out so I set the do not disturb on and when I went back out about 6pm there was a card saying they couldn't clean due to my do not disturb. How about cleaning it earlier than 4pm+ then? Literally the only redeeming feature of the hotel is the pool but it's also very busy and not worth the cost just for that. The rooms are nothing special and everything else is available to anyone anyway, not just hotel guests.

Review: My disappointment runs deep. Upon my arrival around 11 AM, not only was my request for an early check-in disregarded, but I found myself forced to change in a cramped restroom marred by unsanitary conditions, including urine drops on the floor, with no alternatives offered. Lacking any suitable surface to place my luggage, I resorted to capturing photographs of the unpleasant scene. Compounding matters, the absence of complimentary shower shoes—commonly provided by all 5-star hotels—left me with no choice but to wear my conference shoes to the swimming pool. Despite patiently awaiting communication regarding my room's readiness while at the pool, several hours passed without any contact. Faced with both frustration and a sunburn, I eventually returned to the lobby to inquire about the status of my room. Regrettably, the staff displayed a lack of urgency in addressing my situation, despite my earlier plea for prompt assistance. Following a frustrating ten-minute wait and subsequent computer search, I was finally allocated a room. It pains me to say that the demeanor of the lobby staff fell far short of the expected standard for a five-star establishment—marked by unkindness, sluggishness, and a noticeable lack of care.

Review: I honestly don’t know what the main responsibilities of the hotel staff are if they cannot answer calls or reply to emails. During my entire 7-night stay, I was unable to reach anyone regarding the payment status. Even though I had clearly asked in advance not to charge the guest and that I would pay online, the hotel demanded payment in cash at check-in. Be aware that after booking, you may completely lose communication with the staff, and any questions or requests could be left unanswered.

Review: o be honest, I was shocked by the poor condition of the room we were provided. My family and I stayed at your hotel from April 4th to April 6th. Since we arrived before the official check-in time and our original room wasn’t ready, we were offered an alternative — a higher-category room for an additional fee, which we accepted. To our surprise, for 2000 SGD for two nights, we received a dirty room with exposed wiring and loose cables. The lighting was extremely poor, the windows were tiny, and the entire room felt dark and gloomy. It was nothing like what one would expect from a five-star hotel. This experience does not compare in any way to other hotels like The Ritz-Carlton or Kempinski — it was far worse. The hallways were not air-conditioned and smelled strongly of mold. Drilling and construction work were happening right outside our door while our one-year-old child was trying to nap. How could that not be considered when assigning a room to a family with a baby? The carpets in both the room and hallways were dusty and unclean.

Review: We got in around 1044 pm and the was no one manning the door to greet us. We had to lug all our baggage up the stairs and across to the back desk. We booked a club room. We thought we were booking a better room but it was featureless and tired with no decoration. The furniture was tired and scuffed and the carpet frayed at the edges. But the worst thing was the carpet and the bedding really smelled awful. We looked online and saw several people had complained about the smell. We were late and tired and initially thought we would address it in the morning but the smell was so bad we couldn’t stay. We had to ring the duty manager and ask to be moved. By the time we were moved it was 2 am. The room they moved us to was cheaper but much nicer but we paid the full initial price for both nights. Though they gave us a restaurant credit of $200 an arranged a taxi to the airport when we left I was firstly amazed that they had put a guest in such an awful room and then despite us not being able to access a usable room till 2am they still charged the full price for the room. Finally when we went to check out the lady at the desk knew nothing about the restaurant credit or the taxi It was just a pretty awful experience Once we were moved however things were fine but if you go to this hotel avoid the club floor

Review: The majority of the staff at Rasa were not friendly or welcoming. Nor were they particularly helpful or responsive to queries. Each time we asked about something we were told they needed to check and would get back to us, which often took more than 20 minutes for simple queries. The exception was a guest services manager that we encountered, Kathleen, she was bright, bubbly and friendly. She was a ray of sunshine. Otherwise, the hotel facilities were not great. Breakfast was nowhere near as good. Hotel was dated, very hard to use electronics. Also, often when you called guest services there would be no answer. So we would give Rasa 1 star. Review: There were quite a number of things. Don’t go during peak hour as the hotel was understaffed and they seemed to be scrambling to get our room ready (it took them over an hour and with a toddler in tow and us hanging around and waiting for our room to be ready, it was tense). When we went to the pool, there was no one there to provide us with towels so we were pretty much shivering. Plus when we went to get our breakfast, I asked one of the staff for an extra bowl for my toddler and she couldn’t understand basic English. She had to complain to another one of her colleagues and that colleague came to clarify with us the same request. Room service was also horrendous. We clicked on the do not disturb button for our room but right after I managed to tuck the toddler to bed, the noisy phone rang where the reception asked us when they could come to clean the room up. What’s the point of that do not disturb button when the toddler who needed his sleep was going to be rudely awaken by noisy phone calls from room service or the guest reception? one last thing… we ordered in room dining after the toddler fell asleep and we requested for the food to be placed outside the room. The person who brought us our food ended up knocking loudly on the door and he insisted on coming into the room and clanging the tray right beside my child. That woke him up yet again. Overall, we were not pleased with our stay.

Review: 1. Poor Check-in Process & Customer Service: When we were doing the check-in, we were directed by staff to switch between 4-5 different counters. When we finally could check-in, the staff supporting us looked unhappy and she explained the check-in process in a very convoluted manner. She did apologise at the end but the damage was already done. 2. Poor Coordination: On our last day, we requested to do a late check-out. The hotel agreed and said that all was settled. After coming back from breakfast, we went up to the room but were not able to access the room. We called the concierge at the lift lobby and they informed that we had to come back to the main entrance lobby level to settle the cards. After coming down to the main entrance lobby level, they informed us that the cards need to be re-validated here. I told them that they should have informed us earlier, rather than making us do double trips to settle a mere hotel card. They could have also offered to bring up a card for us. 3. Poor Customer Service Recovery: As we shared feedback with them on the above card issue & the poor check-in process, the concierge staff brushed us over and kept glancing at her computer. When we went back to our hotel room, the hotel left us a missed call. When I called back & told them I received a missed call, they asked me what I was calling for. I was puzzled and repeated that this was a missed call. They told me then everything should be fine. When we were finally checking out, I asked them how to do the express check-out. The concierge asked me if I have settled everything outstanding - I was quite surprised and asked him to check.

Review: Having recently stayed at the Ritz-Carlton Singapore, I must confess my disappointment with the overall experience, especially considering the exorbitant price tag attached to the stay. While the hotel boasts a prestigious reputation and is positioned as a five-star establishment, I found the disparity between cost and quality quite glaring. Firstly, the outdated facilities and decor were evident throughout the property. Despite its esteemed status, the hotel appears in dire need of renovation, with worn-out furnishings and aging infrastructure detracting from the luxury ambiance one would expect from a Ritz-Carlton establishment. Moreover, the room rates charged seemed unjustifiable when compared to the amenities and services provided. While I understand the allure of a prime location in Singapore, it hardly justifies the premium pricing, especially when rival hotels offer comparable accommodations at a fraction of the cost. Additionally, the level of service fell short of the standards one would anticipate from a five-star hotel. While staff were polite, their efficiency and attention to detail left much to be desired. Simple requests often took an inordinate amount of time to be fulfilled, and the overall guest experience felt lacking in personalization and warmth. In conclusion, while the Ritz-Carlton Singapore undoubtedly holds a prestigious reputation, it fails to deliver commensurate value for the exorbitant prices charged. Prospective guests would be wise to explore alternative accommodation options that offer superior quality and service at a more reasonable cost.
